title: Sanda Saidan
text:
Sanda Saidan is a village in <a href="Salon%2C%20India">Salon</a> block of <a href="Rae%20Bareli%20district">Rae Bareli district</a>, <a href="Uttar%20Pradesh">Uttar Pradesh</a>, <a href="India">India</a>. It is located 3 km from Salon, the block and <a href="tehsil">tehsil</a> headquarters. As of 2011, Sanda Saidan has a population of 3,283 people, in 592 households. It has one primary school and no healthcare facilities. It does not host a permanent market or periodic <a href="haat">haat</a>.
The <a href="1961%20Census%20of%20India">1961 census</a> recorded Sanda Saidan (as "Sanda Siadan") as comprising 6 hamlets, with a total population of 933 people (456 male and 467 female), in 184 households and 177 physical houses. The area of the village was given as 475 <a href="acre">acre</a>s.
The <a href="1981%20Census%20of%20India">1981 census</a> recorded Sanda Saidan as having a population of 1,460 people, in 356 households, and having an area of 189.90 <a href="hectare">hectare</a>s. The main staple foods were given as wheat and rice.
